title: STEAM-Based Packaging Design Creativity Development Course: Scientific Inquiry and Engineering Approaches

context.prior_knowledge: Requires intermediate-level theoretical background (materials science, engineering design) and practical experience. Possesses basic experimental design and data measurement skills
context.additional_context: Practice-oriented curriculum for current professionals to strengthen workplace applicability. Analysis of correlations between physical properties of packaging materials and user experiences through scientific inquiry processes.

learning_goals: Using the 6-stage CREATE model (Conceive-Research-Experimentate-Analyze-Try-Enhance), learners develop ≥2 functional packaging design prototypes and validate performance with scientific experimental data.
Applying STEAM pedagogy, learners complete ≥1 package design integrating mathematical structures (e.g., geodesic dome geometry) and artistic elements, and analyze physical variables.
Using smartphone-based digital tools (Canva, Figma mobile), learners create 3D renderings and angle variations of packaging prototypes, then optimize designs based on observational results.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
